title: Musician Arrested at Rolling Thunder Event Acquitted of All Charges
description: A motorcyclist, part of the Rolling Thunder convoy, navigates through the crowd during a rally in Ottawa on April 29, 2022. (Dave Chan/AFP via Getty Images)

title: Federal Justice Minister Criticizes Saskatchewan’s Plan to Invoke Notwithstanding Clause Over Pronoun Policy
description: Minister of Justice and Attorney General of Canada Arif Virani speaks during a media availability after a cabinet swearing-in ceremony at Rideau Hall in Ottawa on July 26, 2023. (Justin Tang/The Canadian Press)

title: Hunt Eyes AI and Welfare Reform as Cures for ‘Ever-Rising’ Tax Burden
description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Jeremy Hunt speaking during the British Chambers Commerce Annual Global conference, at the QEII Centre, London, on May 17, 2023. (Jordan Pettitt/PA Media)

title: Wuhan Institute of Virology’s ‘Batwoman’ Shi Zhengli Says Another COVID-19 Outbreak ‘Highly Likely’
description: Chinese virologist Shi Zhengli is seen inside the P4 laboratory in Wuhan, capital of China's Hubei Province, on Feb. 23, 2017. (Johannes Eisele/AFP via Getty Images)

title: Xi Jinping Courts South Korea as North Korea Aligns with Russia, Stirring Unease in China
description: China's National People's Congress (NPC) Standing Committee Chairman Li Zhanshu (L) attends with South Korea's National Assembly Speaker Kim Jin-pyo (R) during a joint news conference with South Korea's National Assembly Speaker Kim Jin-pyo at the National Assembly in Seoul, South Korea, on Sept.16, 2022. (Kim Hong-Ji - Pool/Getty Images)

title: 6 Miners Killed, 15 Trapped Underground in Collapse of Gold Mine in Zimbabwe, State Media Reports
description: An ambulance is parked in Zimbabwe on April 16, 2020. (Zinyange Auntony /AFP via Getty Images)

title: Almost All of Nagorno-Karabakh’s People Have Left, Armenia’s Government Says
description: An ethnic Armenian woman from Nagorno-Karabakh stands near a tent camp after arriving to Armenia's Goris in Syunik region, Armenia, on Sept. 29, 2023. (Vasily Krestyaninov/AP Photo)

title: Video Provides First Clear Views of WWII Aircraft Carriers Lost in Pivotal Battle of Midway
description: The chrysanthemum flower crest, an honored imperial symbol of Japan, can still be seen prominently on the bow of aircraft carrier Akagi 81 years after the aircraft carrier's sinking on Sept. 10, 2023. (Ocean Exploration Trust/NOAA via AP)

title: Mandatory Security Awareness Training Among Changes Since Arrest of Employee: RCMP
description: Cameron Ortis, a senior intelligence official at the RCMP, leaves the courthouse in Ottawa after being granted bail on Oct. 22, 2019. (The Canadian Press/Justin Tang)

title: Sunak Pledges to Stop ‘Blanket’ Traffic-Restricting Schemes
description: Bollards in a street in Cowley near Oxford, to create a Low Traffic Neighbourhood (LTN), on May 5, 2021. (Steve Parsons/PA)

title: A 2nd Man Is Arrested Over Felling in England of Much-Loved Tree Near Hadrian’s Wall
description: Forensic investigators from Northumbria Police examine the felled Sycamore Gap tree, in Northumberland, England, on Sept. 29, 2023. (Owen Humphreys/PA via AP)

title: Blocked-Chain: Tech Giants Defeat Crypto Ad Ban Lawsuit

title: MP ‘Disappointed’ Investigation Not Started Immediately on Nazi Veteran in Parliament
description: Yaroslav Hunka (R) waits for the arrival of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in the House of Commons in Ottawa on Sept. 22, 2023. Several Jewish advocacy organizations condemned members of Parliament on Sunday for giving a standing ovation to a man who fought for a Nazi unit during the Second World War. (The Canadian Press/Patrick Doyle)

title: Calls Mount for National Solution to Toxic Vape Waste
description: A man smokes a vape device  in Manchester, England, on May 30, 2023. (Christopher Furlong/Getty Images)

title: Call for Sydney Minister to Break City Housing Deadlock

title: Taipan Military Helicopters Permanently Grounded
